name: Monochrome Mess Around
description:
Monochrome Mess Around is a simple first person puzzle game created for a game jam at the University of Derby. I was one of 4 developers, the other three of which were my housemates at the time (and still are as of the time of writing).

The premise of the game is to get to the end panel of each stage, coloured yellow. You are equipped with a colour gun, which can pick up and place colours from the environment.
